explanation: Tesla reports its first quarterly profit 11 million. This was the biggest one-day jump in TSLA stock
short_description: First quarterly profit since the company went public

explanation: Argus Research raised its price target to $808 from $556 citing Tesla’s strong fourth-quarter financials which exceeded Wall Street’s expectations previous week
short_description: Strong fourth-quarter financials

explanation: Morgan Stanley analyst changed his rating on Tesla stock from underweight to equal weight citing well-timed capital raise which should help it counter the coronavirus crisis
short_description: Better rating of stock due to well-timed capital raise

explanation: Profitable third-quarter and better than anticipated progress toward getting its Shanghai factory operational. Defied Wall Street Analyst forecasts that called for a quarterly loss
short_description: Profitable third-quarter

explanation: Musk settled the charges with the SEC, agreeing to pay a civil penalty of $20 million and give up his role as chairman of the board for at least three years
short_description: 'Taking private' tweet charges settled with SEC

explanation: Reports that the Model S was cleared of any defect by the German Federal Motor Transport Authority after three crashes involving the car ended in fires
short_description: Model S cleared of defects after crashes involving fire

explanation: Morgan Stanley analyst upgraded the overall auto industry from a cautious rating to an in-line rating. Congress is close to a deal on a stimulus bill to aid the economy amid the pandemic
short_description: Stimulus bill to aid the economy amid the pandemic

explanation: Second quarter earnings report, less-than-expected cash burn, CEO Elon Musk's apologies for his attitude in a previous earnings call
short_description: Optimistic second quarter earnings report

explanation: Deliveries of Model S in the fourth quarter blew past what the company had forecast
short_description: Model S deliveries beats forecast

explanation: RBC Capital Markets analyst cut his 12-month price target for Tesla stock from $530 to $380, citing a challenging environment for luxury autos amid the coronavirus panic.
short_description: Stock price target cut due to coronavirus panic

explanation: Canaccord Genuity analyst cut his rating on Tesla stock from buy to hold. The company said it is delaying deliveries of Model 3 vehicles in China, citing the coronavirus outbreak.
short_description: Delayed deliveries of Model 3 in China due to coronavirus

explanation: Tesla tried to defy the shelter-in-place order in the Bay Area by trying to keep its factory going amid the coronavirus outbreak before the local sheriffs’ department got involved and ordered a shutdown
short_description: Bay Area factory shut due to coronavirus

explanation: Underwhelming third-quarter results, news of third Model S fire
short_description: Poor 3rd quarter, third Model S fire

explanation: Goldman analyst Patrick Archambault put out a report with a price target on the stock of $84, a 34 percent discount to the prior day close of $127.26.
short_description: Goldman Sachs undervalues Tesla stock price

explanation: More than six weeks after Musk tweeted 'funding secured', the SEC sued the Tesla CEO for issuing “false and misleading” statements and for failing to properly notify regulators of material company events.
short_description: SEC sues Elon Musk for 'funding secured' tweet

explanation: Reported a wider-than-expected loss, disappointing revenue and announced the departure of co-founder and CTO JB Straubel from the executive ranks.
short_description: Disappointing revenue, departure of CTO

explanation: The announcement of an ~7% job cut along with Musk’s warnings about challenges and rising competition
short_description: Announcement of 7% job cut, rising competition

explanation: Elon Musk tweets suggesting that he was considering taking Tesla private at $420 a share — which was a 20% premium to the company’s stock price at the time
short_description: Taking TESLA private tweet

explanation: Musk suggested that a British cave diver who was part a team that rescued a Thai soccer team from a cave was a pedophile. Musk made the remark after the diver, Vern Unsworth, dismissed Musk's offer to send a mini-submarine to help with rescue efforts as a 'PR stunt'
short_description: 'Pedophile' cave diver tweet

explanation: Musk committed an epic Twitter gaffe when he projected Tesla's full-year 2019 manufacturing numbers at 5,00,000. The production projection immediately sent the media into overdrive because the estimate was much higher than expected. Hours later, Musk clarified his original tweet, saying he 'meant to say' the company's annualized production rate at the end of 2019 could reach 500,000 vehicles
short_description: Misleading production projection tweet

explanation: As Tesla struggles to ramp up Model 3 production and blows deadlines, Musk issues an April Fools’ tweet declaring his automaker 'bankrupt'
short_description: April Fools' tweet

explanation: After a Tesla in Autopilot mode hit a stopped fire truck, Musk defended the sorta-self-driving system and criticized the media for covering it
short_description: Tweet criticising media coverage of Autopilot accidents

explanation: At an earnings call, during an exchange between an analyst and Tesla’s CFO, about capital expenditures, Musk interrupted suddenly 'Excuse me, next. Boring, bonehead questions are not cool. Next?'
short_description: Boring boneheaded tweet

explanation: Elon Musk appeared to smoke marijuana during an interview streamed on the web
short_description: Marijuana interview tweet
